medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with sinus congestion, headaches, chills, mild nausea, fatigue, and a foggy sensation for approximately 1 week. He also reported darker urine and jaundice.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began approximately 1 week before presentation, with gradual worsening. The patient felt as though he had a fever and experienced malaise for several days. There were no notable symptoms of abdominal pain, pruritus, vomiting, melena, or hematochezia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, seasonal allergies, nephrolithiasis, and an episode of measles at age 9 requiring tracheostomy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked as an engineer, consumes one to two alcoholic drinks per night, and had recent travel to the Turks and Caicos Islands 4 months prior.
